subject: Re: [junit] Avoid System.out
messageBody:
On Fri, 25 Mar 2005 03:06:09 -0800 (PST), m g <mohitjava2k@...> wrote:
>
> There are loggers in java that create the logs of text file of individual
> class at the specifed location.
>
>
> yahoo.com> wrote:
>
>
> Hi,
> When we run Junit test cases, I want to see the output values on
> the screen if the test fails. Currently we are using
> System.out.println (variable) to see the value of the variable. Is
> there any other way to see the values without using
> System.out.println function. Appreciate your
> help. Please respond.
>
> Thanks & Regards,
> Kunam
>

http://www.junit.org/junit/javadoc/3.8.1/junit/framework/Assert.html#assertEquals(java.lang.String,%20boolean,%20boolean)

assertXXX methods have an overloaded version which takes a string that
is outputted in the event of a failure.

James
